alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 5:59PM EDT until July 24 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Point Baker, Roeville, Allentown, Cobbtown, Berrydale, New York, Chumuckla, Indian Ford, Brownsdale, Harold, Chumuckla Springs and Floridale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
